content: Branch: change course to focus on remote-friendly sessions and async collaboration.

Nice. Here’s a concrete plan to create a branch focused on remote-friendly sessions and asynchronous collaboration.

Branch name
- remote-async-collab (or async-remote-first)

Objectives
- Make all collaboration primarily asynchronous where possible.
- Ensure remote participants across time zones can contribute effectively.
- Reduce time-to-feedback by standardizing async workflows (updates, reviews, demos, Q&A).

Scope
- Documentation: remote-first guidelines, async standups, meeting notes, and templates.
- Processes: async-friendly meeting formats, pre-recorded demos, written agendas, and clear handoffs.
- Artifacts: PR templates, update templates, meeting minutes/templates, and onboarding resources.
- Tools and integrations: loom/pre-recorded content, transcripts, Notion/Confluence pages, GitHub PR templates, and chat-thread-based Q&A.

Key changes to implement
- Documentation and templates
  - Create docs/remote_async_guidelines.md
  - Create templates/async_standup_template.md
  - Create templates/meeting_minutes_async.md
  - Create onboarding/async_collab_starter_kit.md
- Meeting formats
  - Introduce asynchronous standups (update in 3 sections: Yesterday, Today, Blockers; optional short video or text)
  - Require pre-recorded demos or walkthroughs for complex topics with transcripts
  - Use written agendas ahead of time; post-notes and decisions in a shared channel
- PR and review changes
  - Update .github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md to include an “Async Review” section and suggested response times
  - Add a template for async code reviews (clear context, links to issues, expected responses)
- Access and inclusivity
  - Time-zone aware scheduling guidelines
  - Captioning/transcripts for all async content
- Onboarding and enablement
  - Async Collaboration Starter Kit (how-tos, tools, templates)
  - Quick-start checklist for new contributors to participate asynchronously
- Metrics and governance
  - Define success metrics (e.g., % of sessions run async, average review time, participation rate across time zones)
  - Maintain a simple dashboard or page with these metrics

Sample templates to create
- Async Standup Template (markdown)
  - Update date:
  - Yesterday: what was done
  - Today: plan
  - Blockers: blockers or requests
  - Questions for teammates (optional)
  - Link to any demo video or artifact (optional)
  - Transcript attached (or note where to find it)
- Async Meeting Minutes (markdown)
  - Date/Time:
  - Attendees (with time zones):
  - Agenda:
  - Decisions made:
  - Action items (owner, due date):
  - Links to recordings/transcripts:
- PR Template (revised)
  - Problem statement
  - What changed
  - Why now
  - How to test
  - Async review expectations and response SLA
  - links to related issues/PRs

Milestones and timeline
- Week 1: Define and publish remote_async_guidelines; create standup and meeting minutes templates; update PR templates
- Week 2: Roll out async standups in pilot projects; add transcripts/ccaptions for existing async content; publish async collaboration starter kit
- Week 3: Collect feedback; adjust guidelines and templates; implement lightweight metrics dashboard
- Week 4: Full adoption in all teams; finalize onboarding materials; review and refine branch changes

Acceptance criteria for merging into main
- All new or updated docs and templates are committed and accessible
- PR templates updated with async review guidance
- At least one pilot async standup and one async meeting workflow documented and tested
- A simple metrics plan is in place and being tracked
- Accessibility (captions/transcripts) implemented for async content where relevant

Risks and mitigations
- Risk: Information loss due to async format
  - Mitigation: require transcripts, decisions documented in shared notes, and explicit action items
- Risk: Overload of asynchronous updates
  - Mitigation: set reasonable SLAs, limit standup length, and rotate owners
- Risk: Resistance to change
  - Mitigation: pilot in a couple of teams, collect feedback, and keep a clear “why” and benefits section in guidelines

Next steps
- Confirm branch name and any tooling constraints (e.g., repository structure, where docs live).
- Decide on pilot teams and start date.
- Prepare initial commit set: remote_async_guidelines.md, async_standup_template.md, meeting_minutes_async.md, PR_TEMPLATE updates.

If you share your repo structure or preferred tools (Notion vs. Confluence, Loom vs. recorded videos, time-zone distribution), I can tailor the templates and commit plan more precisely.

```sh
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Branch: remote-async-collab
# This script sets up a remote-friendly, async-collaboration branch with
# documentation, templates, and PR updates. It creates the branch, files,
# and commits the changes, then pushes to origin.

set -euo pipefail

BRANCH="remote-async-collab"

# Ensure we're in a git repository
if ! git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  echo "Error: This script must be run inside a git repository."
  exit 1
fi

# Ensure we're on the latest main (optional, depends on your workflow)
git fetch --all --tags
DEFAULT_BRANCH=${GIT_DEFAULT_BRANCH:-main}
if git show-ref --verify --quiet "refs/remotes/origin/${DEFAULT_BRANCH}"; then
  git checkout "${DEFAULT_BRANCH}"
  git pull --ff-only
fi

# Create or switch to the feature branch
if git rev-parse --verify "$BRANCH" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  echo "Branch '$BRANCH' already exists locally. Checking it out."
  git checkout "$BRANCH"
else
  echo "Creating branch '$BRANCH'..."
  git checkout -b "$BRANCH"
fi

# Create directories for docs and templates
mkdir -p docs templates onboarding .github

# 1) Remote Async Guidelines
cat > docs/remote_async_guidelines.md << 'MD'
# Remote-First Collaboration: Async Guidelines

Purpose
- Enable effective participation across time zones with asynchronous-first workflows.
- Reduce feedback loop time by standardizing async updates, reviews, demos, and handoffs.

Guiding principles
- Communicate clearly and with sufficient context.
- Use written updates and recordings when possible.
- Capture decisions, rationale, and action items in shared artifacts.
- Ensure accessibility: captions, transcripts, and readable formats.

Time-zone and scheduling
- Schedule with a range of acceptable times; rotate owners for standups.
- Use shared calendars and time-zone aware scheduling notes.

Updates and artifacts
- All updates should be posted in designated channels or documents.
- Include links to recordings, transcripts, or artifacts when applicable.
- Maintain a single source of truth for decisions (meeting minutes, async notes, PR context).

Demos and walkthroughs
- Prefer pre-recorded demos or walkthrough videos (with transcripts).
- Provide written summaries and key takeaways alongside the video.

Reviews and handoffs
- Use a written agenda before meetings; post notes and decisions in shared notes.
- PRs and code reviews should include an “Async Review” section with expected response times.

Accessibility
- Provide captions/transcripts for all async content.
- Use clear, plain-language summaries for non-native readers.

Pilot and governance
- Start with a pilot in two teams; collect feedback after 2–3 weeks.
- Iterate on templates and SLAs; publish updates in the same guidelines doc.

Templates and templates storage
- Store all templates under templates/ with clear naming conventions.
- Maintain version history via Git commits and PRs.

MD

# 2) Async Standup Template (markdown)
cat > templates/async_standup_template.md << 'MD'
# Async Standup Template

Update date:
Yesterday:
Today:
Blockers:
Questions for teammates (optional):
Link to any demo/video/artifact (optional):
Transcript attached (or where to find it):
MD

# 3) Async Meeting Minutes (markdown)
cat > templates/meeting_minutes_async.md << 'MD'
# Async Meeting Minutes

Date/Time:
Attendees (with time zones):
Agenda:
Decisions made:
Action items:
  - Owner:
  - Due date:
  - Description:
Links to recordings/transcripts:
MD

# 4) Async Collaboration Starter Kit (markdown)
cat > onboarding/async_collab_starter_kit.md << 'MD'
# Async Collaboration Starter Kit

Overview
- A quick-start guide for contributing asynchronously to projects.

Tools
- Loom/Pre-recorded content, transcripts, captions
- Notion/Confluence for documentation
- GitHub for PRs and issues
- Slack/Teams channels or an agreed async Q&A thread

Getting started (first 24 hours)
- Read the remote-async guidelines.
- Pick a pilot task and prepare a short async update (standup format).
- Create or locate the async demo/transcript if applicable.

Templates
- Async Standup, Async Meeting Minutes, PR templates, and onboarding resources are in the repo.

How to contribute asynchronously
- Post updates before any synchronous meeting.
- Attach transcripts or captions for all multimedia content.
- Use written agendas and decision notes.

Contact
- Lead for async collaboration: [Name/role], and the channel to use for async Q&A.
MD

# 5) PR Template (GitHub) - updated for async review
mkdir -p .github
cat > .github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md << 'MD'
# Pull Request

Problem statement
What issue does this PR solve?

What changed
- List of changes

Why now
- Rationale and context

How to test
- Steps to reproduce and validate

Async Review
- Expected response time: within 24-48 hours
- Links to related issues/PRs
- Context for reviewers: design decisions, trade-offs

Notes
- Any additional info for reviewers
MD

# 6) Metrics placeholder
mkdir -p metrics
cat > metrics/README.md << 'MD'
# Async Collaboration Metrics

Planned metrics:
- % of sessions run async
- Average time to first review
- Participation rate across time zones
- SLA adherence for async updates and reviews

Data sources
- PR templates, meeting minutes, standup templates, and channel logs

How to track
- Post quarterly into this repo or a simple dashboard link
MD

# 7) Optional: Update a central README (if present)
if [ -f README.md ]; then
  echo "\n\nBranch '${BRANCH}' prepared: added remote-async templates and guidelines." >> README.md
fi

# Stage, commit, and push
git add -A
git commit -m "remote-async-collab: add remote-friendly async guidelines, templates, starter kit, updated PR template, and metrics placeholder"
git push -u origin "$BRANCH"

echo "Done. Branch '$BRANCH' created, files added, and pushed to origin."
```
